content.title: Media Person Pension Scheme
content.department: Department of Information, Public Relations and Languages, Haryana
content.details: The scheme 'Media Person Pension Scheme' was launched by the Department of Information, Public Relations and Languages, Haryana on 7th December 2017. Under the scheme, the Government of Haryana is providing a monthly pension of ₹10,000/- to the accredited media persons of daily, evening, weekly, fortnightly, and monthly newspapers, news agencies, Radio stations, and news channels, above the age of 60 years.
benefits: A monthly pension of ₹10,000/- will be given to the eligible media persons.

In case of the demise of the beneficiary media person, the monthly pension will continue to be given to his/her spouse, provided they are not receiving any salary/wages/pension/any other regular financial assistance.
eligibility: Accredited media persons with at least 20 years of experience in journalism.
Age of the applicant/media person should be above 60 years.
Accredited with the Information, Public Relations & Languages Department, Haryana for at least the last five years.
Must have an Aadhaar-linked savings bank account in a nationalized bank.
No criminal proceedings pending against the beneficiary media person.
Eligible even if receiving a pension from another State Government, but the pension under this scheme will be reduced by that amount if it is less than ₹10,000/-.
exclusions: Pension will be discontinued if any criminal case is registered against the beneficiary media person or if their conduct is found against the principles/ethics of journalism.
documents_required: Proof of Working Experience of at least 20 Years (PDF file containing all experience certificates)

faqs.question: What is 'Media Person Pension Scheme'?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the Government of Haryana is providing a monthly pension of ₹10,000/- to the accredited media persons of daily, evening, weekly, fortnightly, and monthly newspapers, news agencies, Radio stations, and news channels, above the age of 60 years.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Information, Public Relations and Languages Department, Haryana.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 7th December 2017.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Accredited media persons with at least 20 years of experience in journalism.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The age of the applicant/media person should be above 60 years.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: A monthly pension of ₹10,000/- will be given to the eligible beneficiary by the state government of Haryana.

faqs.question: Is a media person eligible to apply if he/she is getting a pension or honorarium from any other State Government?
faqs.answer: Yes, but the pension under this scheme will be reduced by that amount if it is less than ₹10,000/-.

faqs.question: In which condition will the pension under this scheme be discontinued?
faqs.answer: The pension will be discontinued if any criminal case is registered against the beneficiary media person.

faqs.question: Who will get the pension in case of the demise of any media person?
faqs.answer: The monthly pension will continue to be given to the spouse of the beneficiary media person.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant may apply online mode.
